business.headline: Is Venezuela the trigger, or is gold and silver's rally bigger than geopolitics?In India, MCX gold is trading at a lifetime high. A decisive breakout could push prices sharply higher, while lower levels continue to attract buyers rather than panic sellers. MCX silver, trading over Rs 2.5 lakh, remains in an uptrend as long as key support zones hold.

Cupid share price rebounds sharply, up 9% today. Here's whyThe rebound follows a brutal sell-off on Monday, when the stock plunged nearly 20% after a large block deal weighed on sentiment and triggered aggressive profit-booking.

HDFC Bank share price falls over 2% after Q3 business updateHDFC Bank shares were among the top drags on benchmark indices as selling pressure intensified, even as the broader market traded lower in early deals.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Trent shares fall 8%: Why is the stock falling today, and should you buy?Trent share price: The stock opened lower at Rs 4,219.90 and slipped further to an intraday low of Rs 4,060.65, close to its 52-week low of Rs 3,931.45.
Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

US plans talks with oil companies on boosting Venezuela output after Maduro ousterThe meetings are crucial to the administration's hopes of getting top US oil companies back into the South American nation after its government, nearly two decades ago, took control of US-led energy operations there.
Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

Gold prices rise again as US–Venezuela tensions flare. Buy now or wait?Market participants say the latest geopolitical flare-up has reinforced gold's role as a hedge against uncertainty, at a time when investors are already navigating an uneasy global backdrop.

Mis-selling complaints are rising. Here's what IRDAI's latest report showsData in the IRDAI Annual Report 2024–25 shows that grievances categorised under Unfair Business Practices increased to 26,667 in FY25, up from 23,335 in FY24, a rise of around 14% year-on-year.

US action on Venezuela's oil: Is there an opportunity for India?Indian oil refiners and upstream companies could still find opportunities if Venezuelan crude re-enters global markets and long-pending investments and payments are unlocked.

Cupid share price tumbles nearly 20%. Why is it falling today?Cupid shares have now fallen nearly 30% over the past five trading sessions, wiping out a significant portion of the gains made during a recent sharp rally.

Petrodollar power play: How oil dollars connect to the US attack on VenezuelaWhile Washington has cited narcoterrorism charges and security concerns, questions are being raised over whether Venezuela's vast oil reserves and its efforts to trade oil outside the US dollar system played a role.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks see decline in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 68.48 points to 85,693.53, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.35 points to 26,313.20 as of 9:23 am.

Unhappy with pace of change, Tata Group looks to replace Air India CEO: ReportGroup chairman N Chandrasekaran has spoken with chief executives of at least two large airlines based in the UK and the US.

Venezuela cuts crude output as US oil blockade chokes storageCaracas is in political crisis under an interim government after President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces on Saturday. The OPEC country's oil exports, its main source of revenue, are now at a standstill following a US blockade on tankers under sanctions and the seizure of two oil cargoes last month.

entertainment.headline: Where it began again: BTS signals comeback with Seoul installation The group marks its full-band comeback with an installation at the Sejong Center, with global promotions planned for major cities as anticipation builds for the March release of its new album.

Meet Shark Tank India's Kanika Tekriwal, cancer survivor with Rs 420 crore empire Kanika Tekriwal, JetSetGo's founder, overcame cancer and industry scepticism to build India's leading private aviation marketplace. She now appears on Shark Tank India Season 5.

Kangana Ranaut resumes film work, shares update from Bharat Bhhagya Viddhaata set Kangana Ranaut has resumed shooting for her upcoming film Bharat Bhhagya Viddhaata, sharing glimpses from the set on social media.

Dhurandhar box office Day 32: Ranveer film beats Pushpa 2, Sultan global haul Aditya Dhar's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' has achieved major box office milestones, becoming the fifth-highest-grossing Indian film of all time and securing a position among the top 15 highest-grossing Indian films overseas.

Rukmini Vasanth's first-look from Yash's Toxic out, slays in thigh-high slit dress Actor Rukmini Vasanth is introduced as Mellisa in Yash's upcoming film Toxic. The film promises a dark, layered narrative with high-profile action sequences and a grand release in 2026.

Taylor Swift scores longest-running No. 1 with The Fate of Ophelia Taylor Swift's single 'The Fate of Ophelia' achieves its longest run atop the Billboard Hot 100, marking a new milestone for the artist and extending her record of chart-topping hits.

What was inside Deepika Padukone's Rs 15,000 birthday gift hamper for fans? Deepika Padukone celebrated her 40th birthday by hosting a private fan-meet in Mumbai. Here's a peek inside the gift hamper that the actor gave to her fans.

Ikkis box office Day 5: Agastya Nanda's film sees slight dip amid Dhurandhar storm Sriram Raghavan's war drama Ikkis, featuring Agastya Nanda and the late Dharmendra, struggles at the box office after a promising start, facing competition from other major releases and seeing a noticeable drop in audience turnout.

Genelia D'Souza says she doesn't want her kids' arteries blocked, keeps them off ghee During a recent podcast with Soha Ali Khan, Genelia D'Souza explained her cautious approach to including ghee in her children's diets.

Why Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu matters: Chiranjeevi, comedy, and a comeback Mana Shankara Vara Prasad is not chasing spectacle, but a feeling Telugu audiences associate deeply with Chiranjeevi. This Sankranthi, the film carries the weight of memory, comfort and a long-awaited return to comedy.

Emily in Paris renewed for Season 6. What's next for Emily and Gabriel? The popular series Emily in Paris will return for a sixth season on Netflix, following a successful fifth series and continued audience interest.

Riteish Deshmukh opens up on hosting pressures ahead of Bigg Boss Marathi 6 Bigg Boss Marathi Season 6 is set to premiere on January 11, airing on Colors Marathi and streaming on JioHotstar. Riteish Deshmukh returns as host, revealing in a press conference his intention to adopt a calm and observant stance while addressing viewers' and contestants' expectations.

Actor Evangeline Lilly reveals brain damage from head injury, shares health update Evangeline Lilly has disclosed a diagnosis of brain damage following a head injury sustained during a fainting episode at the beach last year. The actor shared updates on her condition and outlook with followers on social media.

The enduring legacy of Ghar Kab Aaoge, Border 2 song that both hurts and heals Nearly three decades after Border, Sandese Aate Hain returns as Ghar Kab Aaoge, reminding us why one of Hindi cinema's most enduring patriotic songs still captures absence, longing, and the silent grief of soldiers and home.

SS Rajamouli's Varanasi teaser creates history with Paris screening at Le Grand Rex The teaser for SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Varanasi was screened at Paris' Le Grand Rex, marking the first time an Indian teaser has been launched at the iconic venue.

Grammy Awards revive album cover category after 50 years to honour visual artists After more than fifty years, the Grammy Awards will once again honour the creative work behind album covers, with a new category that celebrates art directors, designers, and photographers whose visuals shape the musical experience.

The Raja Saab premieres to begin on January 8, tickets priced at Rs 1,000: Report The Raja Saab, starring Prabhas, is set for paid premiere shows on January 8, with multiplex tickets proposed at Rs 1,000 and single screen tickets at Rs 800. The film will release worldwide on January 9.

Jana Nayagan trailer and the Bhagavanth Kesari blueprint that's hard to ignore Jana Nayagan's trailer draws parallels with Bhagavanth Kesari, focusing on women empowerment and political themes. The film doubles as Vijay's political statement ahead of his full-time political debut.

Netflix announces Stranger Things' final season BTS documentary. Watch trailer Netflix unveiled 'One Last Adventure: The Making of Stranger Things Season 5', offering fans an in-depth look at the creation of the acclaimed series' concluding chapter.

general news.headline: Lamp can be lit on hilltop: High Court blasts Stalin govt's 'political agenda'In a setback to the Tamil Nadu government, the Madras High Court upheld an order allowing lighting of Karthigai Deepam at a stone pillar near a dargah atop Thiruparankundram hills, rejecting law-and-order and custom objections.

DMK's 32-seat offer pushes Tamil Nadu Congress to pitch TVK tie-up to Rahul GandhiAhead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly polls, Congress power-sharing talks within the DMK alliance have triggered fresh seat negotiations. Congress sees 40 seats as ideal, DMK is ready with 32, while Congress has lowered its ask to 38.

I'm a prisoner of war: Maduro flips the script on US drug chargesDeclaring himself a "prisoner of war" in a New York court, deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro argued that his capture in Caracas by the US forces was a military action, and not a law-enforcement operation. He pleaded not guilty to US narco-terrorism and drug charges.

Tariff threats, Venezuela invasion: Why is India tiptoeing around Trump?Handcrafted ByOur Editors India's response to the capture of Venezuela's Nicholas Maduro, which conspicuously avoided naming the US, Donald Trump, or condemning the military operation, captured the diplomatic spot India finds itself in while dealing with an increasingly erratic US President.

Genelia D'Souza says she doesn't want her kids' arteries blocked, keeps them off gheeDuring a recent podcast with Soha Ali Khan, Genelia D'Souza explained her cautious approach to including ghee in her children's diets.

Frozen out of Trump's Venezeula plans, Machado wants to give him her Peace PrizeVenezuela opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has offered to dedicate and share her Nobel Peace Prize with Donald Trump after public remarks from the US President signalled Washington's plans for the country would not include her.

I have 6, what's stopping you? Owaisi snipes at BJP leader's '4 children' remarkAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed BJP leader Navneet Rana over her suggestion of having four children to maintain demographic balance, saying he has six children, and asked her what was stopping her from having more.

Military action in Greenland next? What Trump aide said as US vs Denmark hots upDonald Trump has repeatedly signalled his interest in annexing the Danish territory, and following the US's weekend capture of deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro, he has only intensified his rhetoric.

Pune man stuck in balcony calls Blinkit delivery man for 3am rescueTwo friends in Pune got locked out on their balcony late at night and called a Blinkit delivery agent for help, and a video of the moment went viral.

How US weapons, fidayeen attacks made 2025 deadliest year for PakistanConflict-related deaths in Pakistan surged 74% in 2025 to 3,413, the highest in over a decade. The spike was driven by a surge in fidayeen attacks and the proliferation of US-origin weapons from post-withdrawal Afghanistan, revealed the data from the Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies (PICSS), an Islamabad-based think tank.

Indian man who killed ex-lover in US looted lakhs before fleeing, says her sisterIn her complaint to the Indian Embassy in the US, the victim's sister, Saraswati, detailed the amount of money which was taken by Arjun in the days leading to Nikitha's murder. According to the sister's complaint, the total amount Arjun thus owed to Nikitha's family was USD 4,500 (Rs 4.05 lakh).

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 11 | Tolkappiyar: The Creator of the Akam–Puram ArchitectureThe author of Tolkappiyam, Tolkappiyar, may be regarded as one of the earliest anthropologists of the ancient world.
Born with GPS: How Olive Ridley turtles return to the same Indian beachMagnetic sensing forms the backbone of turtle navigation, but it works in tandem with other natural cues.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Drones spotted, gunfire heard near Venezuelan presidential palace in CaracasThe reports came just hours after Vice President Delcy Rodrguez was sworn in on Monday as the country's interim president as deposed leader, Nicolas Maduro appeared in a New York federal court on drug-related charges following the weekend US operation that led to his capture.

The enduring legacy of Ghar Kab Aaoge, Border 2 song that both hurts and healsNearly three decades after Border, Sandese Aate Hain returns as Ghar Kab Aaoge, reminding us why one of Hindi cinema's most enduring patriotic songs still captures absence, longing, and the silent grief of soldiers and home.

Only had 3-6 months to live: Yuvraj recalls beating death during cancer treatmentYuvraj Singh opened up about his life-threatening cancer diagnosis soon after India's 2011 World Cup win. His successful chemotherapy and strong will led to an inspiring return to international cricket in 2012.

Ikkis box office Day 5: Agastya Nanda's film sees slight dip amid Dhurandhar stormSriram Raghavan's war drama Ikkis, featuring Agastya Nanda and the late Dharmendra, struggles at the box office after a promising start, facing competition from other major releases and seeing a noticeable drop in audience turnout.

Exclusive: How India managed Trump, media, trade talks during Operation SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor while engaging the Trump administration in trade and security talks. This dual outreach aimed to manage geopolitical and economic interests amid rising tensions.

Dense fog delays Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer's Vijay Hazare Trophy return in JaipurVijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26: Dense fog and poor visibility delayed the start of as many as four matches in Jaipur on Tuesday. Shubman Gill's Punjab was set to take on Goa while Shreyas Iyer-led Mumbai were up against Himachal Pradesh in their league games in the city.

Mahindra XUV 7XO launched in India, price starts at Rs 13.66 lakhMahindra has unveiled the XUV 7XO in India as the successor to the XUV700, introducing updated styling, enhanced cabin technology and advanced safety features, with prices starting at Rs 13.66 lakh.

400 years ago, this child rebuilt Geometry from scratchBlaise Pascal independently rediscovered classical geometry at the age of 12 despite a ban on formal maths studies. His early breakthroughs foreshadowed significant contributions to mathematics and science, highlighting the power of curiosity and independent thinking.

Why Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu matters: Chiranjeevi, comedy, and a comebackMana Shankara Vara Prasad is not chasing spectacle, but a feeling Telugu audiences associate deeply with Chiranjeevi. This Sankranthi, the film carries the weight of memory, comfort and a long-awaited return to comedy.

Fresh, fit and focused: Can PV Sindhu return to her peak in 2026?At 30, P V Sindhu faces one of the most intriguing challenges of her career: proving that her best days are not in the rear-view mirror. With a series of marquee events lined up in 2026, the two-time Olympic medallist, fresh from an injury layoff, will be hoping for a strong start at this week's Malaysia Open.

sports.headline: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Why Gill is playing under Prabhsimran Singh's captaincy Shubman Gill returned to play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy after recovering from food poisoning but did not captain Punjab. The team management preferred continuity under Prabhsimran Singh as Gill prepares for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

Mustafizur set to miss Rs 9.2 crore IPL salary as compensation unlikely: Report IPL 2026: KKR are not legally required to pay Mustafizur Rahman any compensation, as the termination falls under BCCI directive. Existing IPL contract clauses do not mandate salary protection in such cases.

Steve Smith strengthens Ashes legacy, only behind Don Bradman with 37th Test century Ashes, AUS vs ENG: Steve Smith moved to second in the list of most centuries in the rivalry, going past Jack Hobbs and is only behind the legendary Don Bradman, who has 19 hundreds.

13 years after suspension, cricketer Kranti Gaud's father reinstated in police service Women's World Cup-winning fast bowler Kranti Gaud's father has been reinstated into the Madhya Pradesh Police. He was suspended in 2012 over alleged negligence during election duty.

What led to Stokes and Labuschagne's heated altercation? Stuart Broad reveals Former England fast bowler Stuart Broad revealed what led to the heated conversation between Marnus Labuschagne and Ben Stokes during Day 2 of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

Too bright to bat: Steve Smith asks Brydon Carse to adjust sunglasses mid-play at SCG Ashes, AUS vs ENG: Steve Smith briefly halted play on Day 3 of the SCG Test to ask Brydon Carse to adjust his sunglasses after sun glare disrupted his batting, sparking a light-hearted moment at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Dense fog delays Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer's Vijay Hazare Trophy return in Jaipur Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26: Dense fog and poor visibility delayed the start of as many as four matches in Jaipur on Tuesday. Shubman Gill's Punjab was set to take on Goa while Shreyas Iyer-led Mumbai were up against Himachal Pradesh in their league games in the city.

Ugly way to go: Usman Khawaja out to a full toss in first innings of final Test Ashes, 5th Test: Veteran Australia batter Usman Khawaja got out to a full toss in the first innings of his final Test match. He got a standing ovation from the crowd at Sydney Cricket Ground on Tuesday, January 6.

Jemimah Rodrigues will lead Delhi Capitals to maiden WPL triumph: Shree Charani India left-arm spinner Shree Charani is confident that her team, Delhi Capitals, will finally end the title drought in the upcoming season of the Women's Premier League 2026 (WPL 2026). In a conversation with India Today, she revealed how Jemimah Rodrigues' captaincy will usher in a new era for Delhi and lead them to maiden title triumph.

Only had 3-6 months to live: Yuvraj recalls beating death during cancer treatment Yuvraj Singh opened up about his life-threatening cancer diagnosis soon after India's 2011 World Cup win. His successful chemotherapy and strong will led to an inspiring return to international cricket in 2012.

Head enters record books, hits joint-most 100s by an opener in an Ashes series Travis Head scored a commanding 163 runs on Day 3 of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney. His innings equalled the record for most centuries by an opener in a single Ashes series, joining an elite list of 11 other players.

This Dutch hockey star aims to win Olympic gold, and send it to spaceA solid defender on the field and an engineer off it, Bram van Battum tells India Today how he is able to juggle both his passion for hockey and his dream to become an aerospace engineer. Van Battum will make his Hockey India League bow with SG Pipers.

SA20: Jonny Bairstow slams Keshav Maharaj for record 34 runs in single overJonny Bairstow smashed 34 runs off Keshav Maharaj in a single over during SA20 2025-26. He whacked the left-arm spinner for five sixes and a boundary.

Ponting's advice for Suryakumar amid poor form: Stop worrying about getting outFormer Australia cricketer Ricky Ponting has a piece of advice for struggling India captain Suryakumar Yadav. The T20I skipper has been struggling for form since November 2024.

Fresh, fit and focused: Can PV Sindhu return to her peak in 2026?At 30, P V Sindhu faces one of the most intriguing challenges of her career: proving that her best days are not in the rear-view mirror. With a series of marquee events lined up in 2026, the two-time Olympic medallist, fresh from an injury layoff, will be hoping for a strong start at this week's Malaysia Open.

Captain Suryavanshi's 24-ball 68 seals YODI series win for India vs South AfricaVaibhav Suryavanshi's rapid 68 off 24 balls helped India seal an eight-wicket win against South Africa in the second youth ODI, via DLS method. Suryavanshi narrowly missed out on Rishabh Pant's record for the fastest fifty by an Indian in Youth ODIs during his whirlwind knock.

Bangladesh don't feel secure in playing T20 World Cup in India: Cricket board chiefAfter requesting a venue change, Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam says that they're waiting for a response from the ICC before taking the next step. Bangladesh cricket sent a letter to the sport's international governing body on Sunday, January 4.

Indian cricketer tests positive for dopingAn Indian cricketer from Uttarakhand has failed the dope test, PTI reported on Monday, January 5. Rajan Kumar, who bowls left arm pace, has tested positive for three different substances.

Indian badminton looks for a reset as Lakshya, Sat-Chi begin season in 2026Malaysia Open: Indian badminton endured a difficult season in 2025. As the 2026 season begins, Lakshya Sen, PV Sindhu and Satwik-Chirag will hope to raise their levels once again.

Watch: After Manchester United sack, Ruben Amorim seen smiling in viral videoManchester United has dismissed head coach Ruben Amorim after just 14 months in charge, following the club's draw against Leeds. The decision comes as United sit sixth in the Premier League, with Darren Fletcher set to lead the team against Burnley.

No Virat Kohli in Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy match against RailwaysVijay Hazare Trophy: Senior batter Virat Kohli will not make his return to the Vijay Hazare Trophy in Delhi's next outing against Railways. DDCA president Rohan Jaitley had earlier showed confidence that Kohli would return to the VHT after his mini-break.

Ruben Amorim wasn't a yes man and that's why Manchester United sacked himManchester United have sacked Ruben Amorim after 14 months in charge. However, what finally brought his time at Old Trafford to an end was not merely the club's position in the league table, but his willingness to challenge the authority of those above him, namely Omar Berrada, Jason Wilcox and others within the hierarchy.

Ashes: Ben Stokes unlikely to face sanction over heated exchange with LabuschagneEngland captain Ben Stokes was involved in a brief verbal exchange with Marnus Labuschagne on Day 2 of the Sydney Test, but the incident is viewed as trivial and is unlikely to attract any disciplinary action.

Kohli, I am trying to film with you: MrBeast sends another invite to India starWorld-renowned YouTuber MrBeast, aka James Stephen Donaldson, has sent another invite to India star Virat Kohli to collaborate for a new video for his channel. Kohli is set to represent India in the series against New Zealand.

UP Warriorz await BCCI nod on Pratika Rawal for WPL seasonUP Warriorz head coach Abhishek Nayar said on Monday that the franchise is awaiting a final decision from the BCCI's Centre of Excellence on the availability of India opener Pratika Rawal for the upcoming Women's Premier League season.

Win Asian Games hockey gold, secure LA Olympics qualification and maybe retire: SavitaIndia's veteran goalkeeper Savita Punia has hinted that she may retire from the sport after winning the Asian Games gold this year and securing automatic qualification for the LA Olympics 2028.

Maybe Ruturaj Gaikwad should say I can keep wickets to get India selection: SrikkanthKris Srikkanth has joked that maybe Ruturaj Gaikwad will need to convince the Indian selectors that he can keep wickets to get his spot back in the side. Ruturaj was a surprise omission from the squad for the New Zealand series.

Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah added to national anti-doping agency's testing poolSmriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues have been added to the National Anti-Doping Agency's Registered Testing Pool for 2026. The expanded list highlights India's focus on aggressive testing ahead of the Commonwealth and Asian Games.

Manchester United reluctantly sack Ruben Amorim, offer bizarre explanationManchester United have reportedly sacked Ruben Amorim following the fallout with the club's board in recent days. Amorim's last game in charge came against Leeds United on Sunday, January 4.

On the chopping block: The brewing power struggle over Manpreet Singh's futureA power struggle within Hockey India threatens Manpreet Singh's future, with selectors and coaches at odds as his 411-cap tally nears governing body president Dilip Tirkey's record. Will the 33-year-old remain part of the plans in a busy year that includes the World Cup in August?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
